title: When is the Carabao Cup draw? Time, date and TV channel as quarter-final ties decided

The Carabao Cup enters the business end of the competition with the quarter-final ties set to be decided.

But rather than have the ties determined immediately after Wednesday night's matches are completed, there will be a little wait for the quarter-finals to be set.

That is because the draw is instead taking place the following morning, as the Carabao Cup again continue their run of having obscure locations and timings for their draws.

While this one is not taking place in a supermarket or even in Thailand, it is being done over radio - and not being shown on TV.

Here is all you need to know about the Carabao Cup draw...

(Image: Phil Oldham/BPI/REX)

When is the Carabao Cup draw?

The Carabao Cup Quarter-Final draw will take place on Thursday 31st October. It will start at 08:45am GMT.

What TV channel is the Carabao Cup draw being shown on?

The Carabao Cup draw will not be shown on live television.

What radio station is the Carabao Cup being broadcast on?

The Carabao Cup Quarter-Final draw will be live on The Zoe Ball Breakfast Show on BBC Radio 2.

Who is conducting the Carabao Cup draw?

Former Liverpool and Aston Villa goalkeeper and League Cup winner David James will conduct the draw with Zoe Ball in the studio.

Ball numbers

1. Everton

2. Aston Villa

3. Manchester City

4. Leicester City

5. Colchester United

6. Manchester United

7. Oxford United

8. Liverpool
description: In a change to the norm, the Carabao Cup draw will not be taking place immediately on the evening following the ties
